Description: Painted pottery shabti of Nakhtamun, chiseller with a black lappet-wig with braids, a brown modelled face with black and white eyes, a yellow collar, crossed arms in relief with brown hands holding red hoes; the body is white, the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted hieroglyphs flanked by red lines.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
